about_the_game:
Mineko's Night Market is a narrative-driven, social simulation adventure game that celebrates Japanese culture and invites players to craft whimsical items, eat delicious snacks, and ultimately enjoy all the cats. It features an enchanting score by Daniel Simmons and featuring an equally-large cast of live performers and collaborators playing koto, shamisen, woodwinds, and more. The final track,
"Finale," is a moving arrangement of the main theme featuring Hiroki Kikuta (Secret of Mana, Indivisible).

Mineko's Night Market (Original Game Soundtrack) is made possible by the following:
Composer: Daniel Simmons
Additional Composition: Brent Kobayashi (01), Jessica Stuart (25)
Arrangement: Hiroki Kikuta (27)
Engineering: Chris Stringer (Union Sound)
Engineering: Julian Decorte (Canterbury)
Engineering, Additional Mixing, Mastering: Graeme Campbell
Cover Illustration: Nicole Gustafsson
Agent/Production Assistant for Hiroki Kikuta: Jayson Napolitano
Soundtrack Producer: Jayson Napolitano
Public Relations: Scarlet Moon Promotions
Developer: Meowza Games
Publisher: Humble
Special Thanks from Daniel Simmons: Kathleen Law for supporting me and our family while this was created, and to Brent's beautiful game that inspired the music!

Koto: Jessica Stuart
Flutes, Engineering: Heidi Chan
Electric Piano: Jeff McLeod
